TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BrightnessContrastEffect extends System.Drawing.Imaging.Effects.Effect

Docs.summary: Changes the brightness and contrast of an image.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 brightnessLevel, int32 contrastLevel) cil managed
Public Sub New (brightnessLevel As Integer, contrastLevel As Integer)

param.name: brightnessLevel
param.para: Integer in the range -255 through 255 that specifies the brightness level. If the value is 0, the brightness
remains the same. As the value moves from 0 to 255, the brightness of the image increases. As the value moves
from 0 to -255, the brightness of the image decreases.

param.name: contrastLevel
param.para: Integer in the range -100 through 100 that specifies the contrast level. If the value is 0, the contrast
remains the same. As the value moves from 0 to 100, the contrast of the image increases. As the value moves
from 0 to -100, the contrast of the image decreases.

Docs.summary: Creates a new with the given parameters.

exception.para: is less than -255 or greater than 255 or
is less than -100 or greater than 100.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BrightnessLevel As Integer
public: property int BrightnessLevel { int get(); };

summary.para: Gets an integer in the range -255 through 255 that specifies the brightness level.

Docs.value: An integer in the range -255 through 255 that specifies the brightness level.
Docs.remarks: If the value is 0, the brightness remains the same. As the value moves from 0 to 255, the brightness of the image increases. As the value moves from 0 to -255, the brightness of the image decreases.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ContrastLevel As Integer
public: property int ContrastLevel { int get(); };

Docs.value: An integer in the range -100 through 100 that specifies the contrast level.
Docs.remarks: If the value is 0, the contrast remains the same. As the value moves from 0 to 100, the contrast of the image increases. As the value moves from 0 to -100, the contrast of the image decreases.
